item.title: Benji Bananas Introduces New Token In Response To The Latest Security Breach
item.dc:creator: Harold
item.description:
Benji Bananas introduces BENJI token following a security breach involving PRIMATE tokens.

Read more...

Coincu News
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • Benji Bananas introduces BENJI token following a security breach involving PRIMATE tokens.
  • The new token replaces PRIMATE in Benji’s ecosystem, ensuring continuity for token holders.
  • The token swap process allows PRIMATE holders to exchange their tokens for BENJI at a 1:1 ratio.
In a bid to address the fallout from a security breach that occurred several months ago, Benji Bananas, a cryptocurrency ecosystem, has unveiled a strategic initiative that involves the introduction of a new token called BENJI.

This move comes after approximately 30 million PRIMATE tokens, accounting for 20% of the total circulating supply, were stolen from Benji’s market maker wallet. By launching BENJI, Benji Bananas aims to fortify its ecosystem and provide a secure foundation for its community.

The token swap initiative is designed to safeguard the interests of PRIMATE token holders and bolster confidence within the broader Benji Bananas community. BENJI will serve as the replacement token for PRIMATE and will be utilized in forthcoming Play-and-Earn (P&E) events and across the entire Benji Bananas ecosystem. It is worth noting that the tokenomics, total supply, and circulation of BENJI will mirror those of PRIMATE, ensuring continuity for existing token holders.

To facilitate a smooth transition, the Benji team has already taken a snapshot of PRIMATE token balances in wallets and liquidity pools at the time of the announcement. PRIMATE holders are advised to refrain from transferring their tokens, except for those held in liquidity pools. In light of the upcoming token swap, Huobi, the centralized exchange where PRIMATE is traded, will temporarily halt PRIMATE trading.

The timeline for the token swap process is as follows:

  • A snapshot of PRIMATE token balances was taken at the time of the announcement on July 17, 2023, at 12:30 am UTC.
  • The PRIMATE token claim function on the Benji Bananas website will be temporarily paused until the new token launch is completed. Tokens that remain unclaimed will be available for retrieval once the process is finalized.
  • Trading of PRIMATE tokens on Huobi will be temporarily suspended.
  • New liquidity pools for BENJI will be established, and details regarding these pools will be communicated in due course.
  • PRIMATE holders will be able to swap their tokens for BENJI at a 1:1 ratio, with each wallet permitted to conduct a single swap. The eligible swap amount will be determined by the snapshot and the current PRIMATE balance in the wallet.
  • PRIMATE holders with tokens on the Binance Smart Chain (BSC) are advised to bridge them back to Ethereum in preparation for the token swap.
  • On July 18, 2023, the Play-and-Earn (P&E) claim function on the Benji Bananas website will resume.
  • Over the subsequent month, the ecosystem will transition entirely to using the BENJI token. During this period, PRIMATE holders will have the opportunity to complete their token swaps.
  • BENJI is anticipated to be listed on Huobi on or before July 31, 2023.
  • Special events tailored for on-chain BENJI holders will be announced on Benji Bananas’s community channels.

Benji Bananas game is an action-adventure game with a lot of wonderful elements on it that basically tend to make the game a more fantastic one since everything on it was simply incredibly amazing in terms of how the gameplay could appears like it’s still a great one.

The Benji team has provided comprehensive instructions for PRIMATE token holders, emphasizing the importance of not moving their PRIMATE tokens until the swap process commences. Additionally, a detailed guide explaining the steps required to execute the token swap has been made available, and support will be provided to assist those in need of guidance.

Benji Bananas remains steadfast in its commitment to the security and prosperity of its community. While the security breach was regrettable, the introduction of BENJI and the subsequent token swap initiative are proactive measures aimed at mitigating risks and safeguarding the interests of PRIMATE holders. Benji urges its community members to stay tuned for further updates and encourages them to reach out to official channels for any inquiries or concerns they may have.

DISCLAIMER: The information on this website is provided as general market commentary and does not constitute investment advice. We encourage you to do your own research before investing.

item.title: Token Unlocks This Week Worth About $60M, Featured With APE And AXS
item.dc:creator: Foxy
item.description:
Token Unlocks data shows that 8 crypto projects will unlock tokens this week, with a total issuance value of around $60 million.

Read more...

Coincu News
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • Token Unlocks data shows that eight crypto projects will unlock tokens this week, with a total issuance value of around $60 million.
  • About $31.67 million worth of APE and about $21.62 million worth of AXS will be unlocked this week.
Token Unlocks data shows that 8 crypto projects will unlock tokens this week, with a total issuance value of around $60 million.

Altcoins are currently receiving more public attention than last month due to positive signs from Rippleâ€™s revolt against a formidable opponent like the SEC. This is a big win for XRP and for altcoins. It can be said that XRP is being watched because it is a token that is more centralized in nature than other coins, so if XRP can win the SEC, other coins may have a chance.

Unlocks are scheduled for projects:

  • The ApeCoin APE token unlocked 15.6 million shards (approximately US$31.67 million) at 7:00 am on July 17, representing 1.56% of the total supply;
  • 150 million Arkham tokens, ARKM, will be unlocked at 7:00 am on July 18, representing 15% of the total supply;
  • X2Y2 token X2Y2 will unlock 37.5 million pieces (approximately $970,000) at 10:47 pm on July 18, representing 3.75% of the total supply;
  • 154,380 Euler tokens (approximately $370,000) will be unlocked at 9:22 pm on July 19, representing 0.568% of the total supply;
  • 1inch of 1INCH tokens will unlock 364,290 pieces (approximately $150,000) at 7:00 am on July 20, about 0.024% of the total supply;
  • SPACE ID Token ID will unlock 15.15 million shards (approximately $4.06 million) at 7:00 am on July 22, representing 0.758% of the total supply;
  • The Axie Infinity token AXS will unlock 3.43 million shards (approximately $21.62 million) at 8:10 pm on July 22, representing 1.27% of the total supply;
  • The Cartesi CTSI token will unlock $1.54 million (approximately $240,000) at 11:00 am on July 23, representing 0.154 percent of the total supply.

Token distribution is an important process in the token management of a blockchain project. Token distribution is important to many stakeholders, including investors, teams, users, and the community. However, it also has some risks such as token inflation and token price drop due to the sudden sale of unlocked tokens.

item.title: Fantom Can’t Promise Anything With Stablecoins In Multichain Failure
item.dc:creator: Foxy
item.description:
Fantom Foundation worried users when it responded to the Multichain problem in Telegram with its helplessness before it happened on Multichain.

Read more...

Coincu News
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • The Fantom Foundation said it is contacting Circle and Tether to see if the platform can do anything with the frozen funds.
  • The platform says it can’t promise anything in advance, and there’s probably nothing more that can be done about this incident.
  • Previously, Fantom had to freeze over $60 million USDC and more than $2 million USDT after Multichain announced its shutdown due to the arrest of its CEO.
Fantom Foundation worried users when it responded to the Multichain problem in Telegram with its helplessness before it happened on Multichain.

“That being said, among other things, we’re in touch with Circle and Tether to see if something can be done with the frozen funds. There’s no promises and it might even not be possible to do anything, so keep this info as it is. We’re also trying to understand better what happened and what’s going on with multichain.”

In earlier news, Fantom founder Andre Cronje responded to a user question on the forum that the failure of Multichain was a “severe blow”.

All options are currently being explored, and working with relevant organizations to recover assets, possibly even using Foundation funds. No confirmation can be made until more data is available.

However, the foundation said it will not ignore it and will do what it can to compensate people. In addition, Fantom will continue to work with Circle, Tether, TrueUSD, Binance, and more for native distribution and consider the synthesis of native bridging infrastructure.

As more verifiable information becomes available, Fantom will recommend an action plan. Andre Cronje also stated that the foundation and all employees are exposed to these assets.

The incident started late last week after Multichain officially issued a shutdown notice due to their CEO Zhao Jun being arrested by the Chinese police. This fact was hidden, but before that, many users in China spread in the community. The reason given by the platform for not informing users is due to the influence of legal regulations during the investigation.

After receiving the information, Fantom Foundation made an announcement immediately contacting stablecoin issuers to freeze over $60 million USDC and over $2 million USDT on their Multichain wallet.

DISCLAIMER: The Information on this website is provided as general market commentary and does not constitute investment advice. We encourage you to do your own research before investing.

item.title: Arkham Airdrop Issues: Are Genuine Users Affected By Sybil Terms?
item.dc:creator: Thana
item.description:
Twitter users reported issues with Arkham airdrop, as many users couldn't submit their wallet addresses before the deadline. The team disqualified some accounts for Sybil attacks, raising concerns about genuine users.

Read more...

Coincu News
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • Many users were unable to submit their wallet addresses for Arkham airdrop, despite raising tickets and submitting their account information.
  • The Arkham team disqualified some accounts for Sybil attacks, which raised concerns about whether genuine users were affected by the terms and conditions.
  • Some reported the issues and questioned whether there was a mistake, as they claimed they did not cheat or create multiple accounts.
Twitter users reported issues with Arkham airdrop, as many users couldn’t submit their wallet addresses before the deadline. The team disqualified some accounts for Sybil attacks, raising concerns about genuine users.

Recently, a Twitter account known as GA Crypto tweeted about issues with the Arkham team’s airdrop. The team requested that users submit their wallet addresses before July 16th to receive the airdrop.

However, many users were unable to submit their addresses as there was no option provided. Despite raising tickets on Discord and submitting their account information, users still could not submit their addresses.

According to the Arkham team, the initial airdrop snapshot was taken on July 8th. Sybil attackers, farmers, referrers of inactive users, and other accounts trying to game the system were flagged and are, therefore, ineligible to claim the airdrop.

GA Crypto responded by questioning whether genuine users were also being affected by the Sybil Terms & Conditions. They believed that there must be some mistake and that they did not cheat or create multiple accounts.

Binance Launchpad announced an Arkham token sale: 1 ARKM = 0.05 USD. The snapshot of BNB holdings is from 08:00 am on July 11 to 08:00 am on July 17 (Eastern Eighth District time). The Launchpad hard cap is set at 2,500,000 USD, with a hard cap per user of 15,000 USD (300,000 ARKM). The total token supply is set at 1,000,000,000 ARKM, with 50,000,000 ARKM (5% of total token supply) allocated to Binance Launchpad.

On Tuesday, July 18, the airdrop will go live. To claim, enter the Ethereum address into the platformâ€™s dashboard. Airdrops may only be obtained through the platform and cannot be obtained otherwise.

item.title: UniSat Wallet Launches brc20-swap: Native Swap Platform Allows Users To Grow Liquidity
item.dc:creator: Chubbi
item.description:
UniSat Wallet, the Bitcoin Inscription Wallet, has recently unveiled its native Swap platform called brc20-swap.Â 

Read more...

Coincu News
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • Bitcoin Inscription Wallet UniSat Wallet introduces its native Swap platform, brc20-swap, allowing users to deploy new trading pairs and enhance liquidity.
  • UniSat Wallet provides open-source code, API access, and documentation to support developers in building their own Swap platforms based on brc20-swap, promoting innovation and customization within the ecosystem.
UniSat Wallet, the Bitcoin Inscription Wallet, has recently unveiled its native Swap platform called brc20-swap. 

The announcement, made on July 16, revealed that any user can now deploy new trading pairs on brc20-swap, thereby enhancing liquidity within the platform. Designed to ensure technical compatibility with existing brc20 variants, brc20-swap aims to streamline the trading experience for developers and users alike.

With the launch of brc20-swap, UniSat Wallet aims to empower developers by providing them with the ability to independently deploy instances of the brc20-swap service. UniSat Wallet is committed to supporting developers in this endeavor by offering comprehensive resources such as source code, API access, and documentation. These resources enable developers to build their own Swap platforms based on the brc20-swap foundation, fostering innovation and customization within the ecosystem.

The introduction of brc20-swap showcases the platform’s dedication to facilitating seamless and efficient trading experiences for its users. By allowing users to deploy new trading pairs and add liquidity to the Swap platform, UniSat Wallet enhances the flexibility and accessibility of the ecosystem.

The technical compatibility of brc20-swap with existing brc20 variants ensures smooth integration for developers, minimizing complexities and reducing the barriers to entry for building Swap platforms. UniSat Wallet’s commitment to providing open-source code, API support, and comprehensive documentation further encourages developers to leverage brc20-swap and create tailored Swap platforms to meet specific needs.

As UniSat Wallet continues to evolve and refine its offerings, the launch of brc20-swap demonstrates its commitment to empowering users and developers within the cryptocurrency community. By enabling users to deploy new trading pairs and facilitating the independent development of Swap platforms, UniSat Wallet contributes to the growth and innovation of the broader crypto ecosystem.

As the brc20-swap platform gains traction and attracts more users and developers, UniSat Wallet anticipates further advancements and refinements that will enhance the overall trading experience and contribute to the maturation of the cryptocurrency landscape.

DISCLAIMER: The Information on this website is provided as general market commentary and does not constitute investment advice. We encourage you to do your own research before investing.

item.title: zkSync’s NFT Airdrop: Expanding Access For 169,365 Users After EthCC Success
item.dc:creator: Chubbi
item.description:
zkSync, in response to community feedback regarding the randomness of their LIBERTAS OMNIBUS NFT airdrop, clarified the distribution plan.Â 

Read more...

Coincu News
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • zkSync clarifies that the initial LIBERTAS OMNIBUS NFT airdrop targets the top 10,000 users among 179,365 qualified community members, while the remaining users will be eligible for a multi-stage distribution process after EthCC.
  • Following community feedback, zkSync addresses concerns by expanding eligibility for LIBERTAS OMNIBUS NFTs, ensuring more users have the opportunity to receive them through a fair and inclusive distribution process.
zkSync, in response to community feedback regarding the randomness of their LIBERTAS OMNIBUS NFT airdrop, clarified the distribution plan. 

The airdrop is initially targeted at the top 10,000 users among the 179,365 qualified community members. The remaining 169,365 users will have the opportunity to receive LIBERTAS OMNIBUS NFTs through a multi-stage process following EthCC.

In an official tweet on July 16, zkSync addressed concerns raised by the community regarding the randomness of the NFT airdrop. They explained that the airdrop was designed for the first 10,000 qualified community members and acknowledged that the selection process could be perceived as lacking randomness. To accommodate the remaining eligible users, a multi-stage distribution process will be implemented after EthCC.

Earlier, zkSync launched the LIBERTAS OMNIBUS experimental NFT project and airdropped it to 10,000 early NFT users on their mainnet. The project is a collaboration between zkSync developer Matter Labs and community project Summon. The announcement expressed gratitude to the 179,365 active community members who provided valuable guidance on NFT usage within 113 days of the mainnet launch.

During the initial phase of the experiment, a selection of “kindness” was shared with 10,000 randomly chosen anonymous users from the community, who received the NFTs as part of the airdrop.

zkSync’s LIBERTAS OMNIBUS NFT project aims to explore the potential of NFTs within their ecosystem. While the initial airdrop was limited to a specific number of users, the subsequent multi-stage distribution process will provide an opportunity for more community members to participate and receive the LIBERTAS OMNIBUS NFTs.

As the project progresses and additional details are unveiled during EthCC, zkSync continues to engage with the community and demonstrate their commitment to inclusivity and fair distribution practices.

item.title: Hong Kong Student Arrested For Masterminding $10M Crypto Scam
item.dc:creator: Thana
item.description:
Hong Kong police recently arrested six people, including a postsecondary student, suspected of participating in a cross-border syndicate that laundered over HK$100 million (US$12.7 million) in illegal funds using cryptocurrency.

Read more...

Coincu News
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • Hong Kong police arrest six in cross-border syndicate that laundered over HK$100 million with cryptocurrency.
  • Syndicate used e-wallet accounts to trade digital coins and set up bank accounts in mainland China to collect crime proceeds.
  • Suspects detained for suspicion of conspiracy to launder crime proceeds and defraud.
Hong Kong police recently arrested six people, including a postsecondary student, suspected of participating in a cross-border syndicate that laundered over HK$100 million (US$12.7 million) in illegal funds using cryptocurrency.

The student was believed to have helped the group launder illegal funds by using e-wallet accounts to trade digital coins, concealing the origins and flow of the crime proceeds. The digital coins were ultimately transferred to e-wallet accounts overseas to evade detection. The syndicate set up bank accounts in mainland China to collect crime proceeds generated through various scams.

Members then used debit cards to launder illegal funds by purchasing valuables such as gold ornaments and watches in Hong Kong, which were later resold. The group bought digital coins as an extra layer of transactions to conceal the flow of illegal funds. The Hong Kong police began investigating the syndicate in late April after receiving intelligence and cooperated with their mainland Chinese counterparts.

The six suspects, aged 22 to 36, were arrested in a series of raids across the city on Thursday. They included the alleged ringleader, two core members, and an employee at a watch shop. The student was one of the two alleged core members, while the other two were accused of helping the syndicate use bank cards to make purchases in the city. The group was detained on suspicion of conspiracy to launder crime proceeds and defraud.

Officers seized more than HK$1 million in cash and valuables such as watches and gold ornaments, along with debit cards, during the operation. The suspects were still in police custody as of Friday afternoon, and the investigation was ongoing. Senior Inspector Chu Ming-man of the Hong Kong Island anti-triad squad urged young people to be extra vigilant when taking on summer jobs and reminded merchants to verify the authenticity of buyers’ identities and bank cards.

In Hong Kong, money laundering is punishable by up to 14 years in jail and a HK$5 million fine. Officers from the financial intelligence and investigation bureau also arrested 18 residents on Thursday in a separate operation in a crackdown on a criminal syndicate that laundered more than HK$46 million in illegal funds through over 110 bank accounts.

The illegal funds were generated from 54 cases of deception that occurred since December, including telephone deception, internet love scams, online investment fraud, and email swindles. The suspects, consisting of 11 men and seven women aged 23 to 61, were still being held for questioning as of Friday afternoon.

item.title: XRP Security Or Not? Former SEC Official Reveals Shaky Ground
item.dc:creator: Thana
item.description:
The Ripple lawsuit has been a hot topic. The court ruled XRP was a security when sold to institutional investors, but not to the public on exchanges.

Read more...

Coincu News
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • The SEC sued Ripple Labs for an unregistered securities offering of over $1.3 billion in XRP.
  • The Ripple decision categorized XRP sales into three categories and ruled XRP was a security when sold to institutional investors, but not to the public on exchanges.
  • The decision has sparked controversy and raises questions about the classification of tokens as securities and SEC protection for retail investors.
The Ripple lawsuit has been a hot topic. The court ruled XRP was a security when sold to institutional investors, but not to the public on exchanges.

On December 22, 2020, the SEC sued Ripple Labs Inc. for conducting an unregistered securities offering of over $1.3 billion in XRP, Ripple’s native token. The lawsuit has been a hot topic in the cryptocurrency community, with many wondering whether XRP should be classified as a security.

Former SEC official John Reed Stark said that the XRP decision resides on shaky ground, the SEC is likely for appeal and will likely result in reversal. In the Ripple decision, the Court breaks down the Ripple offering into three categories and rules separately on each category: “Institutional sales,” “Programmatic sales,” and “Other Sales.”

With respect to category one, Ripple’s Institutional Sales of XRP to sophisticated individuals and entities pursuant to written contracts, the court held that XRP was a security when it was sold to institutional investors and thereby constituted an unlawful sale of securities. Those investors are therefore entitled to rescission, and Ripple must pay a penalty for the violation. The court also held that a jury will be needed to decide whether Ripple executives aided and abetted Ripple’s unregistered issuance.

With respect to category two, sales of XRP to the public (whom the Judge refers to as “programmatic buyers” on digital asset exchanges), the court held that XRP was no longer a security when the institutional investors or Ripple sold the XRP anonymously to exchanges because there was no actual privity between exchange customers and Ripple.

With respect to category three, “Other Distributions,” the Court concluded that Ripple’s Other Distributions did not constitute the offer and sale of investment contracts.

The Ripple decision is troubling on multiple fronts. The SEC’s position was that this was a traditional application of Howey, but the Ripple decision seems anathema to the SEC’s mission and authority. Moreover, the Ripple decision appears to declare that if any crypto-issuer sells their tokens through an exchange, then securities regulations do not apply because exchange customers are presumed to not know anything about the crypto-issuer.

The Ripple Court seems to hold that if an issuer does not know who is buying their token and the purchasers do not know who is selling the token, then the token is not a security, even though the issuer used the proceeds from the original, initial sales of the token to fund the issuer’s operations.

The Ripple decision grants full SEC protection and all remedies that go along with SEC violations to institutional investors, but retail investors are not granted any SEC protection at all. This seems backward to say the least. The Ripple Court appears to distinguish the IPO and trading of Apple from the ICO and trading of a token.

DISCLAIMER: The Information on this website is provided as general market commentary and does not constitute investment advice. We encourage you to do your own research before investing.

Read more...

Coincu News

item.title: Weekly Top Crypto News (July 10 â€“ July 16)
item.dc:creator: Harold
item.description:
The ongoing legal dispute between Ripple and the SEC has had a notable impact on the entire crypto industry.

Read more...

Coincu News
item.content:encoded:
In the second week of July, there was a significant surge in the crypto market following news that Ripple’s XRP coin had received a favorable ruling from a U.S. court regarding its securities status. While a final judgment has not been reached, this development is considered positive in the ongoing legal dispute between Ripple and the SEC, and it has had a notable impact on the entire crypto industry, resulting in a market-wide increase in prices. Here, let’s review this week’s top crypto news with Coincu!

Ripple Wins Against SEC After 3 Years Of Lawsuit Led To XRP Surges Over 30%

Judge Analisa Torres rules in favor of Ripple Labs, stating that XRP is not a security in the case brought by the SEC. The court recognizes the sale of XRP as not constituting investment solicitation, extending the ruling to institutional sales by Ripple. After more than three years, the company secured a major win in the legal battle, but further proceedings are expected as the court prepares for the next hearing.

Binance Has Fired Over 1,000 People In Recent Weeks: Report

Binance has laid off more than 1,000 employees worldwide in recent weeks. The layoffs, which could range from 1,500 to 3,000 employees worldwide, last until the end of the year. The cause is speculated to be that the worldâ€™s leading exchange is struggling in a legal battle with the SEC.

Polygon Proposed Upgrade: MATIC to POL Token for Superior Scalability and Security

Polygon plans to upgrade its native token, MATIC, to a new asset called POL as part of the Polygon 2.0 roadmap. The upgrade aims to enhance scalability and security by enabling POL to validate transactions across multiple chains within the ecosystem. The migration process from MATIC to POL is expected to be straightforward, with a grace period of four years for token holders to complete the transition.

Former CEO Of Celsius Network Arrested As Company Faces Collapse And SEC Lawsuit

Former Celsius Network CEO arrested amid company collapse and SEC lawsuit. The collapse of TerraUSD stablecoin and regulatory challenges contribute to Celsius Network’s downfall. The crypto industry faces financial strain and increased regulatory scrutiny.

Grayscale Turns LDO Into Second Largest Defi Token In Its Fund With 19.04%

Lidoâ€™s Token Staking Protocol has been added to Grayscaleâ€™s DeFi Fund. LDOâ€™s proportion in the fund is 19.04%, second only to Uniswapâ€™s UNI with 45.46%. Grayscale said it adjusted the DeFi fundâ€™s portfolio, selling a certain number of existing tokens by the weight of each token and using the proceeds to buy LDO.

Multichain CEO Disappears With User Assets

Multichain CEO Zhao Jun was taken away by Chinese police, leaving the project in crisis. Multichain team maintaining the project to best of their abilities with limited resources. User assets were transferred abnormally, and the police also took away the sister of Zhao Jun.

Arkham Responds To Accusations Of Government Affiliation, User Privacy Concerns

Blockchain company Arkham Intel denies government ties amid backlash over Intel Exchange platform. Concerns were raised about privacy and data misuse with the trading of crypto wallet information. The company refutes data leakage allegations and launches ARKM tokens through ICO on Binance Launchpad.

Layer 2 Linea Mainnet Alpha To Launch Next Week, Officially Competing With L2s

Consensys is preparing to launch the mainnet alpha of its Linea network, a Layer 2 solution built on Ethereum, which enables faster transaction speeds and reduced costs through zkEVM rollups. Linea aims to provide a cost-effective alternative for Ethereum developers and users, with transaction prices up to 15 times lower than Ethereum Layer 1. The network has garnered significant interest during its testnet period, with millions of wallets participating in transactions.

Coinbase’s Layer 2 Base Now Launches Mainnet For Builders

Coinbase’s Base mainnet is now open for builders, allowing them to deploy their projects and prepare for the platform’s general availability in August. Builders joining during this phase will receive a Genesis Builder NFT to commemorate their participation. Base provides support and a range of tools, including node providers, smart wallet infrastructure, block explorers, data indexers, and developer tooling, to facilitate the development process.

Aave Unleashes GHO, The Revolutionary Decentralized Stablecoin Redefining DeFi

Aave launches GHO on Ethereum mainnet, enabling users to mint the decentralized stablecoin. GHO is governed by the Aave DAO, ensuring transparency and community-driven decision-making. GHO introduces innovative features like collateralized borrowing, productive collateral, and multi-collateral support, revolutionizing the decentralized finance ecosystem.

item.title: Celo Wants To Transition To Ethereum Layer 2 In New Upgrade Proposal
item.dc:creator: Harold
item.description:
The Celo community is considering moving to an Ethereum Layer 2 solution, according to a new upgrade proposal by cLabs.

Read more...

Coincu News
item.content:encoded:
Key Points:

  • The Celo community is considering moving to an Ethereum Layer 2 solution, according to a new upgrade proposal by cLabs.
  • The proposed upgrade aims to combine Ethereum’s Layer 2 ecosystem with Celo’s mission of prosperity, offering benefits such as enhanced security and developer experience.
  • The migration would enable collaboration with the Ethereum community and maintain Celo’s low fees and 1-block finality.
The Celo community is considering a significant upgrade to its blockchain infrastructure by transitioning from an independent Layer 1 blockchain to an Ethereum Layer 2 solution, according to a proposal released by cLabs. This proposal comes after months of research and discussions among core Celo and Ethereum community members. The goal is to leverage the capabilities of Ethereum’s Layer 2 ecosystem while maintaining the platform’s mission of creating prosperity for all.

The proposed upgrade outlines a detailed architecture in which the Celo blockchain would become an Ethereum Layer 2 by initially leveraging the OP Stack. This approach offers several key differentiators, including a decentralized sequencer powered by Celo’s existing validator set running Byzantine Fault Tolerance (BFT) consensus. It also incorporates an off-chain data availability layer powered by EigenLayer and EigenDA, operated by Ethereum node operators and protected by restaked ETH. This design enables the platform to maintain its low fees while retaining its 1-block finality.

The transition from an EVM-compatible Layer 1 to an Ethereum Layer 2 solution would be a technical upgrade that does not impact the ecosystem’s mission. In fact, it is expected to accelerate the path towards that mission. The proposal emphasizes that the ecosystem will continue to foster a financially inclusive community and build openly in the spirit of Web3, bringing real-world use cases to the Ethereum ecosystem. At the same time, migrating to an Ethereum Layer 2 solution has the potential to enhance the scope and impact of the blockchain.

Some of the key benefits of this migration include further alignment with Ethereum and EVM compatibility, fostering a seamless developer experience. It also provides stronger security assurances compared to Celo’s individual security measures. Additionally, it offers a trustless bridge to Ethereum, simplifying liquidity sharing between Celo and Ethereum.

From a community standpoint, the proposed upgrade will not bring changes to existing decentralized applications (dApps) or mobile-first features such as SocialConnect. The growing regenerative finance (ReFi) stack will also remain unaffected. Importantly, the proposed changes will have immaterial impact on gas fees, which is crucial in achieving global financial prosperity and aligns with the core mission of the community. The validator community will continue to play a vital role in operating the network.

By implementing the proposed Layer 2 upgrade, cLabs expects several advantages. Firstly, it will facilitate increased cross-community collaboration between Celo and Ethereum. Celo’s technical roadmap has historically aligned closely with Ethereum, and this upgrade will provide an opportunity for even deeper collaboration on existing Ethereum Improvement Proposals (EIPs) and the introduction of new proposals. Secondly, the upgrade will enhance compatibility, making it easier for the platform developers to utilize the full range of Ethereum tooling and libraries. Thirdly, the migration will improve security by anchoring the state on the Ethereum mainnet while leveraging a decentralized source for data availability.

The community has been monitoring Ethereum’s progress, particularly the developments around Ethereum’s rollup-centric roadmap. This upgrade proposal reflects the community’s efforts to future-proof Celo by leveraging Ethereum’s advancements. It demonstrates the strong connection and overlap between the platform and Ethereum communities, both driven by a shared vision of building a fairer financial system on decentralized technology.

Overall, the proposed transition to an Ethereum Layer 2 solution signifies a significant step for Celo in aligning with Ethereum’s ecosystem. It aims to combine the strengths of both platforms to create a more inclusive and efficient blockchain infrastructure. The proposal outlines a clear path forward that balances technical considerations, community impact, and mission alignment, offering a promising future for the ecosystem.
